pr_title: Some proofreading of the recent additions to config.adoc

timeline.bodyText:
@dmlloyd could you have a look at this new section?
I would have expected this to be also valid at runtime but maybe I'm too optimistic?
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -444,31 +444,31 @@ Using `@ConfigProperty("quarkus.profile")` will *not* work properly.
 
 === Using placeholders
 
-Quarkus supports the use of placeholders in the `application.properties` file on build time.
+Quarkus supports the use of placeholders in the `application.properties` file at build time.

replies.bodyText:
Expressions work at the time that the configuration property is read.  If it's a build time property, the expression is expanded at build time, but if it's a run time property, the expression is preserved at build time and expanded at run time.
Also I'm not sure we should be using the term "placeholder"; the term we've used in MP Config so far is "expression" or "property expression".
replies.author: dmlloyd

replies.bodyText:
Yeah I didn't like the term placeholder either.
OK so we need some further tuning of this section.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: :-) I used that term translating the one in German that I had in mind when writing it, "Platzhalter". Will be more careful/inspired next time.

+=== Using Property Expressions
 
-Quarkus supports the use of placeholders in the `application.properties` file on build time.
